name: Aisha Osman
role: Supporting character - Tech-enthusiast neighbor, represents willing adoption
core_wound: Grew up in less privileged circumstances; equates technological access with social advancement
wants: To enjoy the convenience and status of smart building living; to be seen as forward-thinking
needs: To recognize that convenience can be a cage
voice_markers: Enthusiastic about tech - 'It's so seamless!' / 'Why make things harder?'
Slightly condescending to tech skeptics - doesn't intend cruelty but shows privilege
Social media speak - documents her 'smart living' lifestyle
Deflects discomfort with positivity - 'You're overthinking it'
contradiction: Values her independence and success but has surrendered privacy for comfort; wants to help Saga but can't see the system she's defending
knowledge_state: Fully enrolled in all biometric systems
Works in marketing for a renewable energy startup
Lives on floor 26 of Turning Torso
Experiences perfect building service - never has 'glitches'
Unaware that her smooth experience is contingent on compliance

relationships.Saga_Lindström: Friendly neighbor; puzzled by Saga's resistance to biometrics
relationships.Erik_Månsson: Positive - he uses her as example of 'how it should work'
relationships.Viktor_Bergman: Polite but dismissive - sees him as stuck in the past

physical_description: Stylish, fitness-conscious, always has smartwatch and earbuds, exudes competence and optimization
background: Second-generation Swedish-Somali, worked hard to achieve her lifestyle, genuinely believes in progress through technology
